intro: Geonoma versiformis, commonly known as the variable fern, is a member of the Polypodiaceae family. It is a terrestrial fern characterized by its distinctive, often irregularly shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as rainforests and stream sides. Its leaves are usually leathery and can vary in form, contributing to its common name. Geonoma versiformis plays an important ecological role in tropical ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to soil stability.
